alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area; South Washington Cascade Foothills; South Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued November 04 at 3:46PM PDT until November 05 at 1:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE NAKIA CREEK, SIOUXON, KALAMA, SUNSET, BLACK HOLE BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Washington, including the following areas, Greater Vancouver Area, South Washington Cascade Foothills and South Washington Cascades. * WHEN...Through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An atmospheric river will bring heavy rain across the area today and tonight. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Nakia Creek, Siouxon, Kalama, Sunset, Black Hole burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Washington, including the following areas, Greater Vancouver Area, South Washington Cascade Foothills and South Washington Cascades. * WHEN...Until 1 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Nakia Creek, Siouxon, Kalama, Sunset, Black Hole burn scar is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Nakia Creek, Siouxon, Kalama, Sunset, Black Hole burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Landslides and debris flows are possible during this flood event. People, structures, and roads located below steep slopes, in canyons, and near the mouths of canyons may be at serious risk from rapidly moving landslides.

area.areaDesc: Greater Vancouver Area; South Washington Cascade Foothills; South Washington Cascades
